snippet: Militants on Tuesday attacked an Afghan government delegation visiting the village where an American soldier is accused of killing 16 people in a door-to-door rampage.
abstract: Militants attack a high-level Afghan government delegation during a memorial service in the village where an American soldier is said to have killed 16 people; assault leaves at least one Afghan soldier dead, puncturing the calm that has prevailed in the country since the massacre.

byline.original: By TAIMOOR SHAH and MATTHEW ROSENBERG
byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah reported from Panjwai, and Matthew Rosenberg from Kabul, Afghanistan. Sangar Rahimi and Rod Nordland contributed reporting from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: Militants on Tuesday attacked an Afghan government delegation visiting the village where an American soldier is accused of killing 16 people in a door-to-door rampage.

headline.seo: Militants Attack Memorial for Victims of Afghan Killings
headline.main: Militants Attack at Memorial for Massacre Victims
headline.print_headline: Militants Attack at Memorial for Massacre Victims
